abstract: European banks will write down a further 17.6 billion euros, or $27.7 billion, this year and cut dividends in 2009 as they catch up with United States rivals in marking down leveraged loans and subprime assets, JPMorgan Chase analysts said Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: European banks will write down a further 17.6 billion euros, or $27.7 billion, this year and cut dividends in 2009 as they catch up with United States rivals in marking down leveraged loans and subprime assets, JPMorgan Chase analysts said Wednesday.

headline.main: JPMorgan Predicts More Pain for European Banks
